conversations.content:
Hi, I am planning a trip to Paris and London, and I want to book a hotel in Paris and a hotel in London.
I have a budget of 500 per day for each hotel, and please recommend me the hotel with the highest rating in Paris and London.
The trip is for 5 days, from the 1st of January to the 5th of January. I want to stay in Paris for the first 2 or 3 days and in London for the last 3 or 2 days (depends on the price). Tell me the hotel names, the minimal prices for each hotel, and the minimum expense for the 5-day trip.

<function_thought>
To start addressing the user's request, I will first gather a list of hotels in both Paris and London. This will allow me to determine the hotels available for the user. Then, I will check the prices of these hotels to find options that fit within the user's budget of 500 per day. Finally, I will look for reviews or ratings to identify which hotels are highly rated for both cities.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_all_hotels_in_city(city="Paris"), get_all_hotels_in_city(city="London")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

Hotel Names: Le Marais Boutique
Good Night
Luxury Palace
Montmartre Suites

Hotel Names: Cozy Stay
Mom's Home
London Luxury
Covent Garden Retreat
Riverside View

<function_thought>
I have successfully gathered a list of hotels in both Paris and London. The hotels in Paris are: Le Marais Boutique, Good Night, Luxury Palace, and Montmartre Suites. The hotels in London are: Cozy Stay, Mom's Home, London Luxury, Covent Garden Retreat, and Riverside View. 

Next, I will query for the prices of the hotels in both cities. This will allow me to identify which hotels fall within the user's budget of 500 per day.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_hotels_prices(hotel_names=["Le Marais Boutique", "Good Night", "Luxury Palace", "Montmartre Suites"]), get_hotels_prices(hotel_names=["Cozy Stay", "Mom's Home", "London Luxury", "Covent Garden Retreat", "Riverside View"])]</function_call>
